notes.title: Legal Notice

notes.text: Successful exploitation of this vulnerability could allow a malicious user to leak sensitive information if the Workflow visual language of Mendix is used.
notes.title: Risk evaluation

notes.text: CISA recommends users take defensive measures to minimize the risk of exploitation of this vulnerability these vulnerabilities. Specifically, users should:
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: CISA reminds organizations to perform proper impact analysis and risk assessment prior to deploying defensive measures.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: CISA also provides a section for control systems security recommended practices on the ICS webpage at cisa.gov/ics. Several CISA products detailing cyber defense best practices are available for reading and download, including Improving Industrial Control Systems Cybersecurity with Defense-in-Depth Strategies.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Organizations observing suspected malicious activity should follow established internal procedures and report findings to CISA for tracking and correlation against other incidents.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: CISA also recommends users take the following measures to protect themselves from social engineering attacks:
notes.title: Recommended Practices

references.summary: ICS Advisory ICSA-22-195-10 - Web Scraped Version

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements in Output Used by a Downstream Component ('Injection')

notes.text: An expression injection vulnerability was discovered in the Workflow subsystem of Mendix Runtime that can affect the running applications. The vulnerability could allow a malicious user to leak sensitive information in a certain configuration.CVE-2022-34466 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 6.5 has been assigned; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:N/A:N).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: Siemens recommends updating to the latest version of its software if available:

As a general security measure, Siemens recommends protecting network access to devices with appropriate mechanisms. To operate devices in a protected IT environment, Siemens recommends configuring the environment according to Siemens’ Operational Guidelines for Industrial Security and following recommendations in the product manuals.
Additional information on industrial security by Siemens can be found on the Siemens industrial security webpage.
For more information see Siemens Security Advisory SSA-492173.

Additional mitigation guidance and recommended practices are publicly available on the ICS webpage at cisa.gov/ics in the technical information paper, ICS-TIP-12-146-01B--Targeted Cyber Intrusion Detection and Mitigation Strategies.
